[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 91]
Reasoning: **Calculating game strategy**

I'm working through current game actions. I have 9,728 chips but need 16,500, and I have three hands left. My hand includes A♠, J♠, 10♠, J♥, 10♥, 3♥, and 2♥, plus J♣. I’m aiming for a full house, which I've got with three Jacks and two tens — that gives me Jacks full of tens. This awards 65 base level 2 chips. With my jokers, I'll add some more, but certain multipliers won't apply since I'm playing five cards!
**Estimating chip total**

I've got a strategy in place. I'm keeping the 2♥ steel card unplayed for that x1.5 multiplier. Calculating my chips: for a full house at level 2, I start with 65 base chips. Then I consider the cards in play: J(10) three times, plus two tens for a total of 50 from the cards. So, I have 115 chips before adding jokers. 

Adding the blue joker gives me +50, totaling 165 chips. The square joker adds 32 more chips, so now I'm at 197. The base multiplier for the full house is 6, and then with my steel 2♥, it multiplies to 9. I'm double-checking here, and I hope I'm getting this right!
**Finalizing multiplier calculations**

Okay, I’m double-checking the Square joker's effects. It has a +10 multiplier from the holographic edition, which gives an extra bonus. So, it seems like the Square joker adds chips based on its current value and provides an additional +10 multiplier from the holo edition. 

I determined that the total multiplier after applying everything is 38. When I multiply my chips (197) by this, I get 7,486 chips. This means I’ll surpass my target chip goal! Great! My calculations seem solid with the order of effects in mind.
**Reviewing multiplier options**

I’m checking if there are other sources for multipliers, but it seems there aren't any. I need to ensure that playing five cards won't accidentally form a straight or flush, which it won’t since my hand is a full house with J♠, 10♠, 10♥, J♥, and J♣. 

It might be tempting to consider playing four cards for further Square scaling. However, I think it’s more strategic to aim for an immediate win with one hand to maximize my winnings. I'll play the five cards as my intended hand type is "full house," estimating about 7,500 chips!

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
